title: Packet loss or something else?
body:
I had a game last night playing LeBlanc and i was going up against a Zyra...and at around 3 mins into the game i start having these crazy lag spikes and packet loss where my champ would literally stop for a good 5-10 secs before "regaining control" and being able to move again.

Then it started to get worse...**AND MIND YOU WHEN I SAY WORSE I REALLY MEAN WORSE**

My ping was normal at around this time but then It would just jump up to 500ms and then i would start getting the Attempting to Reconnect pop-up
My connection was totally fine at this point.I could open a page and use google and everything else with no issue whatsoever.My internet didn't go out or anything like that.
Just to clarify     **I DO NOT USE WI-FI , I HAVE AN ETHERNET CABLE FOR THE SOLE PURPOSE OF PREVENTING THIS TYPE OF STUFF**

That continued for a good 30 mins and the game was basically ruined.
I quit at the end...
What could actually be the problem and why was i experiencing such problems for the first time for no reason?

replies.body:
Same here, i even checked if my ping drops when i ping at google via cmd... But i had stable 25ms in the cmd while i was running a costum league game with permanent drops up to a 1000ms. Also, noone from the Riot team seem to care about this and respond to me. 
Even if you guys donÂ´t know the problem yet, or whatever you are doing, it would be VERY nice to have an answer at least. I am unable to play ranks atm because of this issue, would loose tons of lp. 

It is clearly a server Issue and none from my side of the connection. So please do something or tell me something i could try or do to stable the connection between me and your servers.

Even with ethernet or a great network, you can still have unstable connection issues.  This could be caused by something local or even how your ISP is routing to the game server.  This could very well be packet loss, but let's find out for sure!  Run a [log reader](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743-Connection-Troubleshooting-Log-Reader) of these matches for an overview of your network.  Let me know the results!
